title: Why experts writing AI evals is creating the fastest-growing companies in history | Brendan Foody
themes: Future of work and AI displacement
key_insights: Evals are becoming the new product requirement documents - if the model is the product, evals define what success looks like
The fastest growth comes from finding leading indicators in rapidly changing markets where wealthy customers pay whatever it takes
Focus on elastic demand industries (software, product management) where 10x productivity increases create 100x more demand rather than displacement
Success requires being stubborn about your thesis of how the world will change but flexible about the exact form it takes
High-performing companies need three pillars: can-do attitude (ambitious goals), high standards (exceptional talent), and intensity (output-focused culture)
The shift from crowdsourced low-skill labor to expert professionals represents a fundamental change in how AI models are trained
Market pull is more valuable than forced product-market fit - look for customers that are surprisingly easy to sell to
Learning to leverage AI tools effectively is becoming as important as domain expertise itself
topics_discussed: AI evaluation systems and their importance
Transition from crowdsourced to expert-driven AI training
Mercor's growth from $1M to $400M revenue in 16 months
Post-training vs pre-training in AI model development
Future of labor markets and job displacement
Skills and careers that will remain valuable
Working with major AI labs (6 of Magnificent 7)
Competition landscape in data labeling industry
AI scaling laws and superintelligence timelines
memorable_quotes: If the model is the product, then the eval is the product requirement document
Models are only as good as their evals
If you really think about it, we were put on Earth to create reinforcement learning training data for labs
frameworks_mentioned: Three pillars of high performance (can-do attitude, high standards, intensity)
recommended_for: People interested in future of work
Investors in AI and marketplace companies
Anyone building or working with AI systems
summary: Brendan Foody, CEO of the fastest-growing company in history (Mercor), explains how the AI industry is entering the 'era of evals' where expert humans are essential for training advanced models. He shares tactical insights on building hyper-growth companies, discovering product-market fit, and preparing for the future of work in an AI-driven economy.
